title: Train Smart
description: Follow a structured training plan that includes long runs, cross-training, and rest days. Gradually increase your mileage to avoid injuries.

title: Hydrate Properly
description: Start hydrating several days before the marathon. Drink water and electrolyte-rich fluids throughout your training and race day.

title: Eat a Balanced Diet
description: Fuel your body with carbs, protein, and healthy fats. Eat a light, high-carb meal the night before the race.

title: Get Enough Sleep
description: Sleep is essential for recovery and performance. Aim for at least 7–8 hours of sleep in the days leading up to the race.

title: Dress Appropriately
description: Wear comfortable, moisture-wicking clothes and proper running shoes. Avoid trying anything new on race day.

title: Warm Up & Cool Down
description: Do light stretching or jogging before the race and don’t forget to cool down and stretch again afterward.

title: Pace Yourself
description: Don’t start too fast. Stick to a steady pace that matches your training. Use a smartwatch or timing app if needed.

title: Enjoy the Experience
description: Stay positive, soak in the atmosphere, and enjoy the crowd support. Smile at the finish line — you earned it!
